common_issues.title: PiecesOS and plugin connection and functionality issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing problems with PiecesOS and its Chrome plugin. Issues include installation problems on Chromebooks with screen flickering and unresponsive buttons, plugin connection failures on Windows, and general functionality issues with both the desktop app and plugin.  Troubleshooting steps should include checking plugin versions, reinstalling the plugin, and ensuring PiecesOS is updated.

related_issues.title: Installation issue in cromebook
related_issues.text:
Installation issue in cromebook
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [ ] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

4.1.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

There are some issues with the Chromebook. When installing core dependencies, the screen flickers, and it takes a long time to buffer. Once loaded, you can't click any buttons, like the "Get Started" button. It just gets stuck on that page.
also it has issue with full screen you can to anything unless minimize

common_issues.title: Pieces software encountering errors on Windows
common_issues.description: Multiple users on Windows report various errors with Pieces software, including processing failures in the desktop app, LTM issues in the CLI, and connection problems with the Chrome plugin.  Issues range from general errors to specific feature malfunctions. Users have provided screenshots and logs. Further investigation is needed to pinpoint the root cause and provide solutions.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and plugin connection issues
common_issues.description: Users report various connection problems with Pieces OS and its plugins across different operating systems (Linux, Windows). Issues include "No available configurations for RGBA pixel format" error on Linux, general connection failures on Windows, and Chrome plugin malfunctions with reported outdated versions despite being the latest from the store.  Further investigation into plugin compatibility and Pieces OS stability is needed.

related_issues.title: Starting error: No available configurations for the given RGBA pixel format
related_issues.text:
Starting error: No available configurations for the given RGBA pixel format
### Software

Pieces OS, VS Code

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Whenever I am trying to start Pieces OS or Pieces For Developers via the Linux Terminal, or via VS Code Plug-In (I don't use / haven't tried other ways), the following error message appears:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3b7cc5de-7fdd-4a36-99f2-c806a7e540d6)


Information about my system:

```
inxi -G
Graphics:
  Device-1: NVIDIA GP107 [GeForce GTX 1050 Ti] driver: nvidia v: 535.183.01
  Display: x11 server: X.Org v: 1.21.1.7 with: Xwayland v: 22.1.9 driver: X:
    loaded: nvidia unloaded: fbdev,modesetting,nouveau,vesa gpu: nvidia
    resolution: 1680x1050~60Hz
  API: OpenGL v: 4.6.0 NVIDIA 535.183.01 renderer: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1050
    Ti/PCIe/SSE2
```

```
uname -a
Linux debian 6.1.0-25-amd64 #1 SMP PREEMPT_DYNAMIC Debian 6.1.106-3 (2024-08-26) x86_64 GNU/Linux
```

Thanks in a advance!

common_issues.title: LTM Issues Across Different Pieces Platforms
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing problems with Long Term Memory (LTM) functionality, including LTM turning off intermittently on macOS, LTM not working in the Pieces CLI on Windows, and general LTM processing errors on Windows.  Issues span different Pieces OS versions. Further investigation is needed to pinpoint the root cause and potential solutions across platforms.

related_issues.title: bug: LTM continues to turn off, requiring me to turn LTM back on periodically
related_issues.text:
bug: LTM continues to turn off, requiring me to turn LTM back on periodically
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I just updated Pieces to try out L.T.M 2.5, and I noticed that the software keeps stopping and restarting on its own. I checked for any updates I may have missed, and none. I restarted the software by forcing it to quit, but the issue persisted. 

The issue only happens when I turn on L.T.M.

recommendations: Prioritize resolving PiecesOS and plugin connection issues across all operating systems (Windows, Linux, macOS, ChromeOS).  This includes addressing installation problems, plugin version compatibility, and general connection failures.
Investigate and fix LTM-related issues across different Pieces platforms (macOS, Windows, CLI). Focus on intermittent disabling on macOS, CLI integration, and general processing errors.
Address the "No available configurations for RGBA pixel format" error on Linux and general processing errors on Windows affecting the desktop application.

Improve communication with users regarding plugin updates and troubleshooting steps for connection issues. Ensure the Chrome store plugin is up-to-date and provide clear instructions for manual updates if necessary.
Monitor and address any new reports related to screen flickering and unresponsive buttons during Chromebook installations.
Consider adding more detailed logging to Pieces software to better diagnose and troubleshoot issues reported by users, especially for connection problems and LTM malfunctions.
Proactively communicate known issues and workarounds to users through a dedicated status page or other channels.
Review and update the support documentation with troubleshooting steps for common issues, including plugin connection problems, LTM errors, and installation issues on Chromebooks.
Analyze user feedback and logs to identify any underlying patterns or trends that may indicate systemic issues with Pieces software or specific features.
Prioritize issues based on frequency, activity level, and potential impact on users. Focus on resolving the most common and disruptive problems first.
Implement a system for tracking and categorizing support tickets to better understand the distribution of issues and identify areas for improvement in the software or support processes.
Consider implementing automated testing to catch compatibility issues and other bugs before they reach users, especially for plugin integrations and LTM functionality across different platforms.
Gather more data on user environments and software versions to better understand the context of reported issues and identify potential compatibility conflicts.
Investigate the root cause of the 404 error encountered when generating summaries and ensure the model is correctly configured and accessible.
Provide support staff with the necessary tools and resources to effectively diagnose and resolve user issues, including access to logs, debugging tools, and updated documentation.
Encourage users to provide detailed information when reporting issues, including steps to reproduce the problem, screenshots, and relevant logs.
Establish a clear escalation path for complex or critical issues that require developer intervention.
Regularly review and analyze resolved support tickets to identify areas for improvement in the software, documentation, or support processes.
Collect user feedback on the support experience and use this information to identify areas for improvement and enhance customer satisfaction.
Consider implementing a user forum or community platform to facilitate peer-to-peer support and knowledge sharing among users.
Explore the possibility of integrating a crash reporting tool to automatically capture and analyze application crashes, providing valuable insights into potential bugs and stability issues.
Investigate and address the root cause of the screen flickering and unresponsiveness issues during Chromebook installations to ensure a smooth onboarding experience for new users.
Provide users with clear and concise error messages that offer actionable steps for resolving common issues, rather than generic error messages that require contacting support.
Develop a system for proactively identifying and addressing potential issues before they are reported by users, such as through automated monitoring and testing.
Consider implementing a beta testing program to allow users to test new features and provide feedback before they are released to the general public.
Regularly communicate with users about the status of reported issues and provide updates on planned fixes and releases.
Provide support staff with training on new features and updates to ensure they are equipped to handle user inquiries effectively.
Encourage users to submit feature requests and suggestions to help prioritize future development efforts and improve the overall user experience.
Track the resolution time for support tickets and identify areas where the support process can be streamlined to reduce response times and improve efficiency.
Regularly review and update the support knowledge base with solutions to common issues and frequently asked questions to empower users to self-serve and reduce the number of incoming support tickets.
Consider implementing a chatbot or other automated support tools to handle simple inquiries and free up support staff to focus on more complex issues.
Analyze user behavior and support interactions to identify opportunities for improving the user interface and reducing the likelihood of user errors.
Develop a system for prioritizing bug fixes and feature requests based on user impact and business value.
Regularly communicate with the development team about user feedback and support trends to ensure that product development aligns with user needs and expectations.
Foster a culture of continuous improvement within the support team by encouraging feedback, sharing best practices, and implementing process improvements.
Track key support metrics such as ticket volume, resolution time, and customer satisfaction to monitor performance and identify areas for improvement.
Invest in tools and resources that can automate repetitive tasks and improve the efficiency of the support team.
Regularly review and update the support processes and procedures to ensure they are aligned with best practices and industry standards.
Encourage collaboration between the support team and the development team to facilitate faster resolution of issues and improve the overall product quality.
Provide support staff with opportunities for professional development and training to enhance their skills and knowledge.
Recognize and reward outstanding performance within the support team to foster a positive and motivating work environment.
Continuously evaluate and refine the support strategy to ensure it meets the evolving needs of the user base and the business.
Stay up-to-date on industry trends and best practices in customer support to identify opportunities for innovation and improvement.
Build strong relationships with users by providing personalized and empathetic support.
Communicate clearly and proactively with users about product updates, known issues, and planned maintenance.
Empower users to self-serve by providing comprehensive documentation, tutorials, and FAQs.
Solicit feedback from users regularly to identify areas for improvement and measure customer satisfaction.
Use data and analytics to track support performance, identify trends, and make data-driven decisions.
Continuously improve the support processes and tools to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.
Invest in the development and training of the support team to ensure they have the skills and knowledge to provide excellent customer service.
Foster a culture of customer-centricity within the organization to ensure that support is a top priority.
Collaborate with other teams within the organization to identify and address systemic issues that impact the customer experience.
Strive to exceed customer expectations by providing proactive, personalized, and efficient support.
